Topic.Title: Unemployment rises to a new hig.................

Message.Msg: Last election showed this society created a whole darn generation of little or half a brain individuals with no regard for hard work or at least some decency to make their own living. It is all about give me this or that. No one wants to lose a thing they receive for granted. Gerard Depardieu showed he has legs.But for most americans who honestly tried to provide for themselves this option is not available, while living your dream became just out of fashion. Obama takes it further and further away .

Topic.Title: Unemployment rises to a new hig.................

Message.Msg: Oh well. Most of those Zuckerbergs, Warren Buffets and Bill Gates are total hypocrites. Pouring money on welware for PR, but when it comes to real life they behave like jerks. It really wouldn't matter if their opinions wouldn't be used to promote political agendas. So best way is to stick those capitalist noses in somethinig they know and do best. Than keep them away from affecting our lives outside of their area of expertise. There is no capitalist who takes money away from me. They can't. Government can and does.

You spend your whole 2008 Bush tax rebate check meant for America's poor already? It's good to see you're doing better. The bampster gets more taxes from me than I'd like, knowing he'll just waste it. What can small business do though? I can run but I caint hide from those 1099's

That's the one I've been using on the leftie rabble rouser . . . what i don't understand is why he's preaching his brand of religion on a board for people who invest in companies with the hope of making a profit and actually being able to KEEP most of it. God knows the government doesn't reimburse us for our losses on the bad years. Why shouldn't they have to pay inverted capital gains tax on the years we LOSE money :-)

Message.Title: You will never guess who awarded father of the year...
Message.Msg: Billy Clinton, this is almost as big of a joke as the placebo president reciving the Nobel Peace Prize. I think husband of the year would have been better suited. Bill Clinton named 'Father of the Year' Former President Bill Clinton is getting props for being a good dad. Clinton was named the “Father of the Year” by the National Father’s Day Council on Wednesday. The group selected Clinton for his “profound generosity, leadership and tireless dedication to both his public office and many philanthropic organizations,” Dan Orwig, chairman of the National Father’s Day Committee, said in the announcement. .
I'm right there with ya Slayer... It looks like even JB can be handled Too! Maybe there's hope for this board for the future...
